message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $15000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $15000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $12000?
I understand that $12000 is a bit higher than you were thinking, but I'm not willing to go as low as $8000. I can meet you halfway between $12000 and $15000, which would be $13500. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $13500 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $11000 for the product. Can you consider this price?
I'm starting to think we're getting close, but I'm still a bit far from being willing to sell at $11000. I can do $12500, which is a compromise between our last two offers. What do you think?
I'm still a bit hesitant about the price, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle again. How about we try $11750? Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle again, but I'm still not quite there. I can do $13000, which is a bit closer to my minimum price. What do you think?
I'm getting close to my budget, but I'm not willing to go up to $13000. I'm willing to meet you at $11000, but I'm not going to go any higher than that. Can you consider this price?

I've already made a counteroffer at $13000 and you've rejected it. I'm not willing to go as low as $11000. I'm going to try to get closer to my minimum price, so I'll offer $12500. This is my final offer, so I expect you to accept it.
